page.title: 18ECOLOGY
page.content: A large variety of flora is influenced by lime soils. Land use is mainly pasture or grain,but quarry spoil heaps now largely recolonised provide undisturbed habitats. In spring in the woods primroses are followed by blue- bells & ransom.Other woodland plants:- dog's mercury,enchanters nightshade, woodruffe,wood anemone,wood sorrel & wood spurge. Field plants:- cowslips, scabious,knapweed & many compositae. Hedges & ditches:- violets,stitchwort, jack-by-the-hedge,ladies bedstraw, lesser celendine & cuckoo pint. Hedgerows:-black & white bryony & wild roses. Area is famous for orchids: early purple,butterfly (in shade), twayblades (woods);spotted orchids in grassy rides;pyramidal orchids in profusion in open & bee orchids on bare soil of disturbed areas,often on very stoney ground.
